a.title: Earn Your GED at Compass High School

nav.div: Comstock Public Schools » News » District News » 2020 School Closure Lunch Program

img.span:
Comstock Public Schools will continue to offer meals as part of the Unanticipated School Closure (part of the Summer Food Program).
Each of the sites will be distributing free meals to any child in Kalamazoo County aged 18 or younger, as well as any special needs adults aged 26 or under who are part of an educational program.
We will be distributing multiple meals on Tuesday (3 breakfasts & lunches) and Friday (4 breakfasts & lunches). Distribution will be either by drive-in or walk-up service, and any adult or child may pick up the free meals. You do not have to be a student of Comstock Schools to participate in the meal pickup.
Because of this emergency closure some of the rules regarding this meal distribution have been relaxed. The meals must be taken home to be eaten and there is no eating at the sites.
All sites will be operating on Tuesday and Friday starting on April 3.
Comstock High School
In the bus loop from 11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.
Bus Service #1
- Celery Street Park - 11:30am – 12:30pm
- Electra St. /Collette St. -12:35-12:50
- 5447 Josephine St. - 12:55-1:10
Bus Service #2
Compass High School - 11:30-12:00
Big Bend Apartments - 12:10-12:30
Comstock Village Apartments - 12:40-1:00
Pavilion Estates – 11:30am – 1:30pm
Two Comstock School vans (1 starts at the front and the 2nd starts at the back and goes up and down each street- distributing to families who come out to the van when it is near their home)
11:30am – 1:30pm
Families should be prepared for a large quantity of food and milk, so it will be wise to bring a laundry basket, box, wagon, etc.
Comstock Families are also eligible to receive additional funds through the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer Program.
Read more.
For questions about the meal service, please contact Holly Wait at waith@comstockps.org.
If you would like to help in any way with these efforts, send an e-mail to FoodHelp@ComstockPS.org or sign up here.

div.div: 3010 Gull Road, Kalamazoo, MI 49048 | Phone (269) 250-8900 | Fax (269) 250-8901
